dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis c Gunaratne b Madushanka 185 (141b 16x4 3x6 212m) SR: 131.2

dismissalComment.html: clubs that high and down to long-on to end a magnificent knock. Length ball, Faf went cross-batted but didn't time it well. Looked a tired shot, not much strength on that, and long-on did superbly to come in a few steps, get underneath the ball and pouch it safely. Sri Lankans applaud as he walks off, what entertainment he's given the crowd. Faf falls three short of equalling Gary Kirsten's record for highest individual score by a South African

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers b Pathirana 64 (62b 4x4 0x6 81m) SR: 103.22

dismissalComment.html: Bowls AB through the legs. Pathirana breaks the dangerous stand. AB pre-meditates, shuffling across off stump for a paddle-sweep. Nicely tossed up by Pathirana, drifts in, rather than turning away. AB is bowled through the legs. Just too full. Pathirana hits the top of middle

dismissalComment.html: edged and superbly taken by Tharanga diving to his left. Pouched it with both hands. De Kock can't convert this fifty into a hundred. Liberally tossed up in the air, only 77.7ks, the ball dips, which means De Kock does not meet the pitch after stepping out. He's nowhere close to the pitch. He ends up wafting and nicking to slip

dismissalComment.html: poor stroke from Amla, ideal start for the visitors. Short of length delivery outside off, there was width alright, but the extra bounce meant the forceful drive wasn't really on, ended up getting a thick edge that was taken cleanly by Gunaratne at first slip.

headshotImage.caption: JP Duminy headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: JP Duminy headshot

dismissalComment.html: this time, Duminy has lofted it straight to Mendis coming in from deep cover. This was a touch short, he looked to go over the top behind point but didn't place it as well as he would have liked as he met the ball a lot earlier. Mendis made the catch look a lot easier than it was

headshotImage.longCaption: JP Duminy headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Duminy b Parnell 119 (90b 11x4 7x6 121m) SR: 132.22

dismissalComment.html: huge moment in the match. Is that a game-changer? Tharanga's exhibition is over and it will be very sad if it were to end in a losing cause. Newlands faithful applaud, Tahir runs up to him to shake his hand. The Sri Lankans in the dressing room applaud. What a moment. Coming back, this was short and wide outside off, Tharanga could have had a real go at that one if he liked, but he somehow just held back a touch and ended up steering it straight to backward point.

headshotImage.longCaption: F Behardien headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Niroshan Dickwella c Behardien b Pretorius 58 (47b 9x4 0x6 65m) SR: 123.4

dismissalComment.html: Pretorious breaks the rapid opening stand. Dickwella jumps down the track, probably does so early. Pretorious pulls his length back further and tucks 'em up. It gets big on him as he sends a top edge to Behardien at deep square leg. He just held on

headshotImage.caption: WD Parnell headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: WD Parnell headshot

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: there's a wicket against the run of play. It's the pace that has resulted in the wicket. Mendis walks across the stumps to pull a short ball aimed at the rib cage, Mendis is too late on the stroke and can only glove it to Quinton de Kock. Needless shot, really. All he needed to do was nudge the ball and give his captain the strike. Got to question the match awareness. Thinnest of edges, ultraedge confirms and South Africa have broken a 64-run stand

Newlands faithful applaud, Tahir runs up to him to shake his hand. The Sri Lankans in the dressing room applaud. What a moment. headshotImage.caption: Lahiru Madhushanka player page headshot cutout 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lahiru Madhushanka player page headshot cutout 2021

dismissalComment.html: full and outside off, steps away outside leg, dares to drive in the air, holes out to cover. SL nine down. Glum faces in the SL dressing room. Madushanka toe-ends a catch to Pretorius. SL lose five wickets in 19 balls

headshotImage.caption: Lakshan Sandakan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lakshan Sandakan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: SA go 4-0 up. Parnell lets out an almighty roar, finishing with four wickets. Time for the dab dance in the stands. Slower delivery on the leg stump, Sandakan backs away, slogs early and that's timbaaaaah. The off-bail is tipped off

headshotImage.caption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kagiso Rabada player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dhananjaya de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dhananjaya de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: reverse swing has done the trick and Sri Lanka are falling apart. Full, straight and tailing in late, Dhananjaya plays all around it and is hit on the full. It was just a half-appeal from Rabada but that was a sign of how plumb it was, perhaps. The umpire didn't take long either. Dhananjaya had the option of reviewing that, but I think he knew too that he was absolutely dead there. The collapse is on. South Africa have wrested the initiative here and are on their way to, I dare say, 4-0. Oh, dear. Replays suggest that would have missed leg.

headshotImage.caption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: dug in short and outside off, Asela goes for the pull again. He hits it straight to Amla at midwicket. Chest-high catch for Amla

commentTextItems.html: SA go 4-0 up. Parnell lets out an almighty roar, finishing with four wickets. Time for the dab dance in the stands. Slower delivery on the leg stump, Sandakan backs away, slogs early and that's timbaaaaah. The off-bail is tipped off

commentPostTextItems.html: 9.20pm SA secure their 13th successive win at home in ODIs. Oh boy! they seem unstoppable. A clean sweep will carry them to the No.1 ranking. SL, who had not topped 200 until this match, made a proper fist of a 368 chase. Thranga and Dickwella gave the visitors a rollicking start; the SL captain went onto hammer a 73-ball hundred - his 14th in ODIs - but the lower-middle order simply fell away in the slog overs. SL lost their last six wickets in just 28 balls to be dismissed for 327. Do stick around for the presentation.

Tharanga: We needed to get a good start. Someone had to get that start for us. It was a much-better batting performance. Till the last 10 overs, we were in the game. It is a really good wicket. Credit to Faf and AB, they batted really well. There is little turn for the spinners. Our main concern is batting, this was better, hopefully we do well on Friday.

De Villiers: The batting was great. Faf played an exceptional knock. Great be there in the middle with him. You don't often get such days. Very happy for Faf. Fudgie chipped in with clean hits. It was a bit slow in the afternoon than it was in the evening. It sped up in the later stages of the game and well done to the groundsman. Tharanga played well. There was not a lot of panic, I was pleased with the variety in the bowling. We wanted to hold KG back a little bit and bowl him in shorter spells. He was nice and fresh and when I needed him most at the end he was there. It is tricky changing the side, the guys were motivated. I am prod of the performance tonight.

Du Plessis, Man of the Match: It is going okay. When you're in good touch, you make sure you score big runs. There was something in for the bowlers - some bounce. De Kock took pressure off me. Then the innings was about risk management. My blueprint of scoring is eliminating dots. Then AB is brilliant with running between the wickets. Not once [did you think about the 200?]. If you bowl a good back of a length slower ball, it was difficult to hit and I holed out. I will take 185 and pretty grateful for that.

Sri Lanka finally turned up, and showed plenty of fight, despite the late slide. Hope you enjoyed the game as much as we did bringing it to you. Thanks for tuning in, be back for the final ODI. Goodbye and good night for now

Raees : "Collectively South African team has more than 64 Centuries vs 13 centuries for Sri Lanka , that's from a single batsman . Played with the most inexperienced cricket team in last two decades. I will take this as a win for us :) Well played boys. Let's make it 4-1 "
Aayush: "This match's first maiden comes in 98th over of the match, resembles how good game this has been"

commentPreTextItems.html: Two slips in place, by the way

commentTextItems.html: back of a length on leg stump, Kumara sneaks away outside leg and lets the ball go

commentPostTextItems.html: SD: "Believe it or not: The 98th over of a 7 rpo match is a maiden."

commentTextItems.html: full and outside off, steps away outside leg, dares to drive in the air, holes out to cover. SL nine down. Glum faces in the SL dressing room. Madushanka toe-ends a catch to Pretorius. SL lose five wickets in 19 balls

full and outside off, right in the slot to nail it down the ground. The batsman does not make contact, though

dismissalText.commentary: Sachith Pathirana c de Kock b Pretorius 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 33.33

commentTextItems.html: One-hander, and De Kock makes it look easy. The ball sticks in the webbing. Pathirana can't believe it and drags himself off the field. Banged in just outside off, he aims to ramp it over the keeper. De Kock leaps and completes a stunner. SL lose four wickets in 15 balls

dismissalComment.html: clubs that high and down to long-on to end a magnificent knock. Length ball, Faf went cross-batted but didn't time it well. Looked a tired shot, not much strength on that, and long-on did superbly to come in a few steps, get underneath the ball and pouch it safely. Sri Lankans applaud as he walks off, what entertainment he's given the crowd. Faf falls three short of equalling Gary Kirsten's record for highest individual score by a South African

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Duminy b Parnell 119 (90b 11x4 7x6 121m) SR: 132.22

dismissalComment.html: huge moment in the match. Is that a game-changer? Tharanga's exhibition is over and it will be very sad if it were to end in a losing cause. Newlands faithful applaud, Tahir runs up to him to shake his hand. The Sri Lankans in the dressing room applaud. What a moment. Coming back, this was short and wide outside off, Tharanga could have had a real go at that one if he liked, but he somehow just held back a touch and ended up steering it straight to backward point.

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Mendis c de Kock b Parnell 29 (34b 3x4 0x6 45m) SR: 85.29

dismissalComment.html: there's a wicket against the run of play. It's the pace that has resulted in the wicket. Mendis walks across the stumps to pull a short ball aimed at the rib cage, Mendis is too late on the stroke and can only glove it to Quinton de Kock. Needless shot, really. All he needed to do was nudge the ball and give his captain the strike. Got to question the match awareness. Thinnest of edges, ultraedge confirms and South Africa have broken a 64-run stand

dismissalText.commentary: Dhananjaya de Silva lbw b Rabada 5 (14b 0x4 0x6 18m) SR: 35.71

dismissalComment.html: reverse swing has done the trick and Sri Lanka are falling apart. Full, straight and tailing in late, Dhananjaya plays all around it and is hit on the full. It was just a half-appeal from Rabada but that was a sign of how plumb it was, perhaps. The umpire didn't take long either. Dhananjaya had the option of reviewing that, but I think he knew too that he was absolutely dead there. The collapse is on. South Africa have wrested the initiative here and are on their way to, I dare say, 4-0. Oh, dear. Replays suggest that would have missed leg.

dismissalText.commentary: Lakshan Sandakan b Parnell 1 (2b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: SA go 4-0 up. Parnell lets out an almighty roar, finishing with four wickets. Time for the dab dance in the stands. Slower delivery on the leg stump, Sandakan backs away, slogs early and that's timbaaaaah. The off-bail is tipped off

headshotImage.caption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Kusal Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: there's a wicket against the run of play. It's the pace that has resulted in the wicket. Mendis walks across the stumps to pull a short ball aimed at the rib cage, Mendis is too late on the stroke and can only glove it to Quinton de Kock. Needless shot, really. All he needed to do was nudge the ball and give his captain the strike. Got to question the match awareness. Thinnest of edges, ultraedge confirms and South Africa have broken a 64-run stand

headshotImage.caption: WU Tharanga headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: WU Tharanga headshot

dismissalComment.html: huge moment in the match. Is that a game-changer? Tharanga's exhibition is over and it will be very sad if it were to end in a losing cause. Newlands faithful applaud, Tahir runs up to him to shake his hand. The Sri Lankans in the dressing room applaud. What a moment. Coming back, this was short and wide outside off, Tharanga could have had a real go at that one if he liked, but he somehow just held back a touch and ended up steering it straight to backward point.

dismissalComment.html: full and outside off, steps away outside leg, dares to drive in the air, holes out to cover. SL nine down. Glum faces in the SL dressing room. Madushanka toe-ends a catch to Pretorius. SL lose five wickets in 19 balls

headshotImage.longCaption: Niroshan Dickwella player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Pretorious breaks the rapid opening stand. Dickwella jumps down the track, probably does so early. Pretorious pulls his length back further and tucks 'em up. It gets big on him as he sends a top edge to Behardien at deep square leg. He just held on

headshotImage.caption: Sachith Pathirana player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sachith Pathirana player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: One-hander, and De Kock makes it look easy. The ball sticks in the webbing. Pathirana can't believe it and drags himself off the field. Banged in just outside off, he aims to ramp it over the keeper. De Kock leaps and completes a stunner. SL lose four wickets in 15 balls

headshotImage.caption: Dhananjaya de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dhananjaya de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: reverse swing has done the trick and Sri Lanka are falling apart. Full, straight and tailing in late, Dhananjaya plays all around it and is hit on the full. It was just a half-appeal from Rabada but that was a sign of how plumb it was, perhaps. The umpire didn't take long either. Dhananjaya had the option of reviewing that, but I think he knew too that he was absolutely dead there. The collapse is on. South Africa have wrested the initiative here and are on their way to, I dare say, 4-0. Oh, dear. Replays suggest that would have missed leg.

headshotImage.longCaption: Asela Gunaratne player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: dug in short and outside off, Asela goes for the pull again. He hits it straight to Amla at midwicket. Chest-high catch for Amla

headshotImage.caption: KMDN Kulasekara headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: KMDN Kulasekara headshot

dismissalComment.html: Trapped in front. Slider, pings the back toe in front of middle. Kulasekara reviews it. No snick. Kulasekara has to go after swinging across the line. He misses the full-toss. Impact in line and hitting middle and leg

Tahir collects two wickets off full-tosses. SL lose three wickets in nine balls. Slider, Sandun pre-meditates, eyes another big reverse. This time he can only skew the ball high in the air. Parnell tracks down the skier running in and sliding on his knees from backward point
